text: when I would heal Israel,
and the corruption of Ephraim is revealed,
and the wicked deeds of Samaria;
because they deal \add in\add* falsehood,
\add the\add* thief breaks in,\f + \fr 7:1 \ft Or “comes in” \f*
\add and the\add* bandit raids the outside.
⸤But they did not consider⸥\f + \fr 7:2 \ft Literally “But they did not say to their heart” \f*
that I remember all their wickedness.
Now their deeds surround them;
they are before my face.
By their wickedness they make \add the\add* king glad,
and \add the\add* officials by their treacheries.
All of them commit adultery,
like a burning oven
whose baker has stopped from stirring the fire,
and from kneading \add the\add* dough until it is leavened.
\add On\add* the day of our king, the princes
became sick \add with\add* the heat of wine;\f + \fr 7:5 \ft This phrase refers to the effects of wine on the body \f*
he stretched out his hand with mockers.
Because they are kindled\f + \fr 7:6 \ft Hebrew “they drew near;” other ancient translations read “they are kindled” \f* like an oven,
their heart burns within them;
all night their anger ⸤smolders⸥,\f + \fr 7:6 \ft Literally “sleeps” \f*
\add in the\add* morning it blazes like a flaming fire.
All of them are hot as an oven,
and they devour\f + \fr 7:7 \ft Or “they eat” \f* their rulers.
All their kings have fallen;
there is none who calls to me amongst them.
Ephraim mixes himself
with the nations;
Ephraim is a bread cake
not turned over.
Foreigners devour\f + \fr 7:9 \ft Or “Foreigners eat” \f* his strength,
and he does not know \add it\add*;
⸤mold⸥\f + \fr 7:9 \ft Literally “grey hair,” but in this case the word refers to the “hairs of mold” on food \f* is also sprinkled upon him,
and he does not know \add it\add*.
The pride of Israel ⸤testifies against him⸥\f + \fr 7:10 \ft Literally “answers against his face” \f*—
they do not return to Yahweh their God;
they do not seek him for all of this.\f + \fr 7:10 \ft Or “in all of this” \f*
Ephraim was like a dove,
silly, ⸤without sense⸥;\f + \fr 7:11 \ft Literally “without heart” \f*
they call \add to\add* Egypt,
they go \add to\add* Assyria.
Just as they go, I will cast my net
over them;
I will bring them down
like the birds\f + \fr 7:12 \ft Hebrew “bird” \f* of the heavens;\f + \fr 7:12 \ft Or “sky” \f*
I will discipline them
according to a report to their assembly.\f + \fr 7:12 \ft Hebrew uncertain \f*
Woe to them, because they have strayed from me!
Destruction to them, because they have rebelled against me!
I myself would redeem them,
but they speak lies against me.
They do not cry out to me from their heart,
but they wail on their beds;
because of grain and new wine they lacerate\f + \fr 7:14 \ft Or “gash” \f* themselves;
they depart from me.
And I myself trained
and strengthened their arms;
but they plan evil against me.
They turn, not to the Most High,\f + \fr 7:16 \ft Hebrew uncertain; the NRSV translates “to that which does not profit”; the NASB translates “but not upward” \f*
like a slack bow;
their officials will fall by the sword
because of the anger of their tongue.
This \add is\add* their scorn\f + \fr 7:16 \ft The NRSV translates “So much for their babbling” \f*
in the land of Egypt.
